definition: system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: In the middle of Yuan Dynasty, the terracotta technology in CiZao reached its peak.
sentences.chinese: 元朝中叶，磁灶制陶技术达到鼎盛时期。

sentences.english: Pottery-making schools spring up like bamboo shoots after a spring rain.
sentences.chinese: 春天像制陶学校竹笋一场春雨过后。

sentences.english: Pottery is a craft alive, but the pottery artisans are decreasing.
sentences.chinese: 制陶是个手艺活，但制陶的手艺人却逐年减少。

sentences.english: Pottery is a craft alive, but the pottery artisans are decreasing.
sentences.chinese: 制陶是个手艺活，但制陶的手艺人却逐年减少。

sentences.english: A fairly straightforward nickname that originates from the large connection with the pottery industry in North Staffordshire.
sentences.chinese: 源自球队与所在地北斯塔福德郡制陶工业的紧密联系。

sentences.english: Paters and Potters add water to soften the clay.
sentences.chinese: 制陶工人会加一些水来软化黏土。

sentences.english: Is in the Ming and Qing Dynasties the lower level system ceramic entrepreneur wooden construction and the brick wooden construction condition portrayal.
sentences.chinese: 是明清中下层制陶业者木构和砖木建筑状况的写照。

sentences.english: Pastern? ( Potters ) and(add) water to soften the clay.
sentences.chinese: 制陶工加水使其变的更加柔软。

sentences.english: Japan has the longest pottery-making tradition in the world.
sentences.chinese: 日本拥有世界上最长的制陶传统。

sentences.english: At the beginning of Song Dynasty, the terracotta technology in CiZao has been booming.
sentences.chinese: 宋朝初期，磁灶制陶技术得以迅速发展。

definition: to make ceramics (on a potter's wheel)
black eggshell pottery (of the Neolithic Longshan culture)
